p: Trametinib ( 91), selumetinib ( 92), everolimus, rapamycin, dasatinib, and imatinib are examples of inhibitors of kinase signaling pathways, which are active against SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (see, for representative example 91, 92 in Fig. 13). Their mechanism of action is to block the ABL1, ERK-MAPK and/or PI3K-AKT-mTOR pathways, which may block early viral entry and/or postentry events. However, the major drawback of the inhibitors may be associated with immunopathology 145, 146.
